item.title: Real Wedding//Kelly & Phillip
item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
Leigh, Genevieve, Meagan, Caitlin and I arrived at the Hayfields Country Club bright and early. We beat Kelly and her bridal party. We set up, we got excited and spied the wedding set up. I just love when the 'getting ready room' over looks the reception. When Kelly and her friends showed up it was like a burst of puppies, candy canes and rainbow. 

Her girls were some of the most amazing bridesmaids I've seen. Seriously, they should qualify for some type of award. They poured specialty mimosas. chatted in their matching shirts and told us stories of Kelly and Phillips courtship. It was a perfect way to start off Kelly and Phillips wedding day. Kelly, you looked smoking hot. Just want to put that out there. 
xo, 
Alison


If you haven't yet, you need to go check out 
Dani Leigh Photography. 

She is so uber talented and well, really nice. 
 
Ps. The wedding was also featured on Charm City Wed's blog!



 
Hair & Makeup: 
Leigh
Caitlin
Meagan
Genevieve

item.title: Alison Harper Style//Chesapeake Bridal Awards
item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
When I woke up this morning, I checked my email. My squealing woke my husband. We've been chosen as one of the top ten beauty vendors by the Chesapeake Bridal Awards!  


Yeah! Seriously. I am so excited. Our girls deserve this kind of recognition. They are the hair and makeup artists that get there on time through the driving rain, they do trials on Christmas eve, the artists who get in major accidents and get taxi's to the wedding. Above their dedication they are actually REALLY GOOD. We are the master of the smokey eye, the duplicators of style me pretty updos past.My girls rock. They deserve this. 



  Now we've made it as a finalist but there is still a little  more work. We need your help. I would just love you forever if you would vote for us. I mean, we are pretty nice. You can vote twice, its done through facebook: 



Bayside Bride's Facebook Page

Charm City Wed's Facebook Page

We are the first option in the "Beauty" Drop down. Thank you so much for your continued support. Our girls rock the casbah and its about time we show them. 
Xo, 
Alison

item.title: Real Wedding//Amy's Classic Cloisters Wedding
item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
It was beautiful. The whole thing. Amy, the weather, the vows. All of it. We were so lucky to be asked to come make all her lady friends feel pampered. The venue they were married is beautiful. Its an old world style castle tucked up in the woods of Baltimore. It makes you feel like you've been transported back in time or something like that. In fact, its where Will Smith and Jada were married. A little fun fact for your Tuesday morning. Amy, it looks like you had a really fabulous day. Thank you for inviting us in. 
Xo, 
Alison


Please Check out Artful Weddings. 
 


Hair: 
Martha

Makeup: 
Jen

item.title: Real Wedding//Natalie & Bryce
item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
The morning of Natalie's wedding we rolled into her suite at the Gaylord, very very excited. Then it started raining. The rain turned to storming. Lights flickering. Natalie was in Nikki, from Beauty in the Brides chair getting her makeup done when it started storming. I've seen wedding day rain, tornadoes and snow storms. This was insane. It was tree bending wind, sleeting and the entire time Natalie was getting her makeup done near the window watching it. 

She kept her cool. Which totally describes Natalie. She was cool as a cucumber. That is, if cucumbers wore Coco Chanel and really chic wedding dresses. She is one really cool cucumber. 

Her girls, boy were there a few of them, were all around getting ready with her. They were a really beautiful group. I mean, don't trust me -see for yourself. This wedding was one of the most glamorous in our fall season and has so much eye candy. Enjoy! 
Congrats Natalie & Bryce!
xo, 
Alison


Please check out one of my very favorite photographers: 

Michelle Lindsay Photography

item.title: Personal//Have Enoughs
item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
Growing up without a lot was a constant game of "have enough." Watching other kids in their new back to school cloths with fancy Christmas gifts, family vacations. After years of envy I had to  learn to weigh value in the personal. I have more unconditional love then most. I did lack but what I lacked was made up for in support, laughter and that indescribable feeling of complete acceptance by those around me.

Lately I've been really caught up with the "have enough." I heard a quote that grabbed it right from my brain.  The one above this paragraph. It's so easy to do that. All anyone puts out there is only their very best. It's difficult to not compare all the things your read about all the things on Facebook, instagram or blogs. I just need to remember that I am blessed beyond measure. I have a loving and supportive husband. No, if I'm being honest -he may not stare deep in my eyes and tell me every thought on his mind. No he doesn't send me flowers or write me poems. No, but he shows me in his steady day to day actions. I have a sparky, brilliant dog who somehow wanders in at just the right moment to tug at my heart. I have a beautiful, sweet mother who is always just a phone call away. Literally. I have the most involved and caring siblings. 


More than any one human deserves.
 
Lovely photo of Jd I by my friend Christine Barker Photography

I have a business that I truly feel has a purpose. It is bigger than me. I get the joy of liberating artists from their 40 hour. I get to give women who have never felt it, hope that they could provide for their family. We get to celebrate and make women feel beautiful on a day. This is one of the most important missions.

 Not that overly preyed on "biggest day of your life." Truly, I think that day is reserved for when you welcome your first born. We get to be a part of a day that is so privately important between to people. We help boost a woman's confidence on her most vulnerable day. We help to make her feel comfortable in that big dress, in front of anyone she knows. We help her feel confident while she bares her heart and publicly acknowledges her trust and care to another person. We get to be a part of that.


How can you place value on such things? How can I compare those things?
I am blessed beyond what any human deserves.

Xo, 
Alison

item.title: Real Wedding//Bliss & Simo
item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
Oh Bliss. Yes, you read that right. Her name is actually Bliss. She came to us for her engagement shoot asked us to come back for her wedding day. She and her new hubby were married at St. Patricks on Capital Hill. They were a relaxed and really down to earth bunch. Their reception was held at a close family friends. They had the brightest, lovely flowers. Oh, I just love intimate weddings. This just goes to show that you can do personal, intimate weddings while still looking DC chic. Love. 
Xo, 
Alison


They rock. 
Thank you to our friends at 
Timmester Photography

Journey

Jen

item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
Please let the record show that I am really not a football fan. Like at all. However, with the super bowl coming up on Sunday and the fact that the team from my state -I kind of feel obligated to acknowledge it. Yes, the Ravens are going to the super bowl. If my husband saw this post, he'd throw my computer out of the window. So don't tell him. 

In honor of Baltimore heading down south to throw the ball around, I thought I would use this Friday to post some lovely purple details. Enjoy, 
Alison

item.title: Personal//1 Year
item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
Exactly one year ago, I woke up in a hotel room in Georgetown with the sun. I crept out to breakfast with my mom and wore my pjs to the venue. I busted into the old catholic school and checked on linens, flowers and table cards. I made sure our guestbook was where it should be, that the aisle decor was exactly what I wanted. I made sure the cake was delivered and the dj was setting up. I was overwhelmed, flustered, excited and getting married. 

 
Jen & Gabby hard at work making me feel like a princess. 

I married Jd on February 18, 2012. It was a beautiful whirlwind. It was exactly like everyone told me it would be, yet some how still completely different. Everything flew by. I looked up and I was getting my hair done with a glass of champagne  the next thing I knew we were kissing at the alter and then having our first dance. Before I knew it we were boarding the plane for our honeymoon. I really don't know the point of this post. I don't want to offer tons of advice, I am by no means a marriage expert. I do know this, your wedding day happens so quickly its -over before it starts. 

Everyone tells you "make sure you sit back and take it all in" Its really hard to do when you have everyone vying for your attention and wanting to take a photo with you. Its a lot. The best thing that Jd and I did that day was sneak away. 

We argue for a week about whether we should do a receiving line or if we should sneak off for a few minutes alone after the ceremony. He thought it was rude if we didn't greet our guests, I thought we would need five minutes alone. Like most things with wedding planing, he caved. After the ceremony we snuck off to a private room for a few minutes. 

 

The wedding was so very stressful and overwhelming. I remember standing at the alter squeezing his hand on the verge of tears and trying not to fall over in my 6 inch heels. When we shut the door in that quiet little room, I grabbed his arm and sank into his chest. We cried and wiped our tears and touched each others faces. It was the most beautiful moment in our entire day. It was completely private and gave us time to exchange our thoughts. We wrote each other letters that morning and when we were alone we read them. It was perfect. The entire day flew by and we were able to slow down for a few minutes and collect ourselves. 

If I could offer just one small piece of advice, sneak away after the ceremony. Your bridal party can wait 5 minutes, your photographer can wait. Everyone can wait. Just take a few minutes to relish in it with you new love. This is a memory that is just for he and I. 

--------------------------------------------

Happy Anniversary husband of mine. You have been a godsend, the most supportive and loving person in my life. This has been a hell of a year but I wouldn't have done it any differently. I love you.

Xo, 
Alison
 
This beautiful photo was taken by Jd's family, Mary Ann Knapp

item.title: Real Wedding//Jill & Jeremy
item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
These two lovebirds. REALLLLLY!?  -fabulous. They are. They were married a little while back, but I realized that their beautiful shining faces hadn't made it to our new blog. Jill and Jeremy were married at the Aspen Wye River Conference Center. It was the perfect backdrop for their outdoor garden wedding.

 I was reading through the amazing Megan Beth Photography's blog and she told such a sweet story of their wedding day. For their first dance, they met on the dance floor and the music started. Seconds later as Jeremy spun Jill around the floor she looked up and realized, it wasn't the dj. It was Jeremy's sister and her husband serenading them. Such a beautiful moment. 


Jill and Jeremy had a beautiful day, surrounded by a strong supportive group of friends and family. Jill, thank you for letting us come in to help make you and your ladies beautiful. 
Xo, 
Alison

Please check out our friend
Megan Beth Photography

item.title: Personal//Thank You
item.dc:creator: alisonharperco2013
item.content:encoded:
Before the holidays really begin for me, I wanted to take a very heartfelt second to say thank you to a few very important people. My artists. Truly, I would not be able to work on this dream if it were not for this group of talented women rowing in the boat beside me. I know that I get a lot of credit for things but I can honestly tell you that if it were not for this group of hard working, dedicated women you wouldn't know my name. Each of these women have driven through snowstorms, purchased products over new shoes, stayed and worked with a client through a 5 hour trial or two. They have explained to their husbands and wives why they have to go to work at 3am and still love their job. They have dealt with mother-in-laws from you-know-where and they still smile about how they are helping people to love themselves. I am proud to work along side these women, to have them on my team. Each and everyone of them carries a talent all their own. Thank you, to each of you for having my back this season. Let's have a beautiful 2014. xo
Thank you to
Kaitlyn Katy Gabriela Tiera Tiffany Abby Sierra Nikko Norma Jesseca Kamilah
Anne-Marie Libby Katelyn Kelsea Brittany Martha Jen Lee Shelby Ilda Shelley Amy
